meanings.definition: To begin or start doing something
meanings.sent1: I will takeup painting this weekend.
meanings.sent2: She likes to takeup new hobbies every month.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to takeup knitting, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm tookup the whole room like a bright light.
meanings.sent5: Let's takeup dancing to have fun and stay active.

meanings.definition: The amount of space or time occupied by something
meanings.sent1: The takeup of the new sofa was too big for the living room.
meanings.sent2: The takeup of the meeting room was quick due to the early start.
meanings.sent3: The takeup of the tiny car by the clown made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The takeup of the sky by the clouds signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The takeup of the bookshelf in the corner was perfect for the room.

meanings.definition: The action of taking up or collecting something
meanings.sent1: Her takeup of donations for the charity event was successful.
meanings.sent2: The takeup of trash from the park was a community effort.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's takeup of nuts for winter storage was impressive.
meanings.sent4: The takeup of memories in the photo album brought back happy times.
meanings.sent5: The takeup of shells on the beach was a favorite pastime for the children.
